required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety Study Looking at the Effects of Stendra on Vision
clinical_study.official_title: A Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Single-Dose, Parallel Study to Assess the Effects of Avanafil (STENDRA™) on Multiple Parameters of Vision, Including, But Not Limited to Visual Acuity, Intraocular Pressure, Pupillometry, and Color Vision Discrimination, in Healthy Male Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to see if Stendra causes any changes in vision, eye pressure, pupil dilation, and color vision in healthy males.

detailed_description.textblock: The objectives of this study are to assess the effect of Stendra on visual acuity, intraocular pressure, pupillometry, and color vision discrimination in healthy male subjects.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Color Vision Discrimination 1 Hour Post Dosing
primary_outcome.description: Color vision discrimination was performed using the Lanthony 40-Hue Test according to Farnsworth-Munsell 100-Hue Test. The total error score was derived by counting the number of caps misplaced.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Visual Acuity 1 Hour Post Dosing
primary_outcome.description: Visual acuity was measured using the Logarithm of the Minimum Angle Resolution (LogMAR) chart. The LogMAR value of the best line read was noted and the number of letters read in the next row was multiplied by 0.02, then subtracted from the LogMAR value of the best line completely read.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Pupil Dilation 1 Hour Post Dosing
primary_outcome.description: Pupil dilation was measured using the Neuroptics Model VIP 200 pupillometer under standard lighting conditions.

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Intraocular Pressure 1 Hour Post Dosing
primary_outcome.description: Intraocular Pressure was measured using the Goldman applanation tonometry

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Visual Acuity 24 Hours Post Dosing
Change From Baseline in Pupil Dilation 24 Hour Post Dosing
Change From Baseline in Color Vision Discrimination 24 Hour Post Dosing
Change From Baseline in Intraocular Pressure 24 Hour Post Dosing
secondary_outcome.description: Intraocular pressure was measuring using the Goldman applanation tonometry

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy adult males 18 to 45 years of age, inclusive
- Non-tobacco user for at least 6 months prior to first dose
Exclusion Criteria:
- History or presence of retinal disease or any vision defects including color vision
- Intraocular pressure value ≥ 22mm Hg
- Resting heart rate < 45 or > 90 beats per minute (3 rechecks)
- Systolic blood pressure < 90 or > 140 mm Hg or Diastolic blood pressure < 50 or >90 mm Hg (3 rechecks)
- Initiation or change in dose of any α-blockers 14 days prior to randomization

baseline.population: healthy male adults between the ages of 18 and 45

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Color Vision Discrimination 1 Hour Post Dosing
outcome.description: Color vision discrimination was performed using the Lanthony 40-Hue Test according to Farnsworth-Munsell 100-Hue Test. The total error score was derived by counting the number of caps misplaced.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Color Vision Discrimination 1 Hour Post Dosing
measure.description: Color vision discrimination was performed using the Lanthony 40-Hue Test according to Farnsworth-Munsell 100-Hue Test. The total error score was derived by counting the number of caps misplaced.

analysis.groups_desc: The sample size had enough power to detect any meaningful difference between treatment groups in the right eye.
The sample size had adequate power to detect a meaningful difference between treatment groups in the left eye.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Visual Acuity 1 Hour Post Dosing
outcome.description: Visual acuity was measured using the Logarithm of the Minimum Angle Resolution (LogMAR) chart. The LogMAR value of the best line read was noted and the number of letters read in the next row was multiplied by 0.02, then subtracted from the LogMAR value of the best line completely read.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Visual Acuity 1 Hour Post Dosing
measure.description: Visual acuity was measured using the Logarithm of the Minimum Angle Resolution (LogMAR) chart. The LogMAR value of the best line read was noted and the number of letters read in the next row was multiplied by 0.02, then subtracted from the LogMAR value of the best line completely read.

analysis.groups_desc: The sample size provided enough power to detect any meaningful difference between the two treatment groups in the right eye.
The sample size provided enough power to detect any meaningful difference between the two treatment groups in the left eye.

measure.description: Pupil dilation was measured using the Neuroptics Model VIP 200 pupillometer under standard lighting conditions.

analysis.groups_desc: The sample size provided enough power to detect any meaningful difference between the two treatment groups in the right eye.
The sample size provided enough power to detect any meaningful difference between the two treatment groups in the left eye.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Intraocular Pressure 1 Hour Post Dosing
outcome.description: Intraocular Pressure was measured using the Goldman applanation tonometry

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Intraocular Pressure 1 Hour Post Dosing
measure.description: Intraocular Pressure was measured using the Goldman applanation tonometry

analysis.groups_desc: The sample size should provide approximately 90% power to detect a 1.6 mmHg difference in the mean change in Intraocular Pressure between the two treatment groups in the right eye.
The sample size should provide approximately 90% power to detect a 1.6 mmHg difference in the mean change in intraocular pressure between the two treatment groups in the left eye.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
